Tech students return to seek 'closure'





Virginia Tech is allowing students to drop classes without penalty or to
accept their current grades if they want to spend the rest of the year at
their parents' homes grieving last week's campus massacre.

Navy identifies fallen aviator





The military Sunday identified the U.S. Navy Blue Angels aviator who died in
Saturday's crash as Lt. Cmdr. Kevin Davis.

Wind sends Georgia wildfire smoke into Tennessee





An overnight wind shift drove smoke from the wildfire in southeast Georgia to
Atlanta and Chattanooga, Tennessee, officials said Sunday.

Presidential impersonator gets no competition from Bush





President Bush, deferring to the tragedy at Virginia Tech, passed up any
attempt to be funny at the White House Correspondents' Association dinner
Saturday, leaving those efforts to impersonator Rich Little.

Performance review may have sparked NASA shooting





Police said Saturday that a bad performance review may have led a NASA
contractor to fatally shoot his supervisor and take another employee hostage
before killing himself.

Texas jury awards $9 million to beating victim 





A jury awarded $9 million to a black man who suffered permanent brain damage
after being beaten and dumped in a field by four men in 2003.

Gunmen execute 23 members of Kurdish sect





Gunmen shot and killed 23 members of an ancient religious sect in northern
Iraq after stopping their bus and separating out followers of other faiths,
while car bombings in the capital killed at least another 20 people.

Sarkozy, Royal in presidential runoff





Right-wing candidate Nicolas Sarkozy and Socialist Segolene Royal began
campaigning for the centrist vote Monday.

Nigeria election 'flawed,' monitors say





Nigeria's presidential election was so badly flawed that it should be
cancelled and held again, the biggest local election observer group said on
Sunday.

Quake triggers waves that leave 3 dead, 7 missing in Chile





Rescuers found the bodies Sunday of three people who were swept out to sea by
huge waves triggered by a powerful earthquake that sent avalanches crashing
into a fjord in southern Chile. Seven others were missing.

Gasoline prices: up, and rising

further rise -- according to a national survey released on Sunday.

the name. A boy's name, surely, not a name for a high-powered attorney?
